reviews.review_msg: Incredible professor. He is so caring and even learns the names of all of his students. His lectures are heavy on material but he makes sure to make everyone review everything by having multiple quizzes. He is so passionate about the material so he is a very good lecturer. He is very fair. Loved his class and his teachings so much.

Mike is one of the best and most knowledgable biology profs in the department. He always gives very thoughtful answers to questions, isn't afraid to say when he doesn't know something, and makes you want to learn about the material regardless of the grade. Highly recommend to take a class with him+ ultra nice (final questions from quizzes)

Mike is an incredible professor. Lectures are a bit heavy, and you have to take a lot of notes, but he does post all the videos, so you can catch up on what you missed. His syllabus is well-organized, and he is very knowledgeable, caring, and easy to approach. exams are a bit tricky, but the interesting topics make up for it. Recommend his class.

Mike is an extremely knowledgable biologist. His lectures are very dense, and it can be hard to follow along if you space out for even a minute. But he really cares about his students. If you ask him questions over email or in person, he will give you thoughtful answers. The quizzes are very hard and rely on your ability to memorize things.

Great Prof. Really helpful outside of the class. You have to take a lot of notes, and the quizzes are not easy. But gives a lot of bonus marks and is an easy marker.  Textbook not mandatory. Recommended.

Mike is a great prof but his quizzes are extremely insane, I studied like crazy and could barely pass it. It expected you to memorize the most smallest details. Lecture is very content heavy and slides only have pictures. He doesn't stress on what he will test on, so you are practically judging whats important yourself. Goodluck!

I'm not sure why Mike's reviews are so low. Mike is a super kind professor that is passionate about what he does. While the format of his lectures could be improved upon (his slides are just images, leaving lots of writing to be done in lectures), his exams are relevant to the course material and doable if you study it like any other biology class

Mike is a very passionate and kind lecturer, he really loves sharing his knowledge and his boomer jokes are funny & well-timed. The tests are quite difficult, but as someone who never studied for the tests and barely-to-never read the textbook I definitely passed and still enjoyed the course. Do try to attend the lectures and read the textbook tho

Mike is great at explaining things and super passionate. However, he covers WAY too many details and obscure groups, and the lectures are too heavy for the course to be enjoyable. Tests are quite difficult, and the course requires an obscene amount of studying and memorizing super niche details - a more focused approach could be beneficial.

Mike is a nice guy but he is not a good lecturer. His lectures are long and meandering and he will easily put you to sleep. His slides are just images so you have to take thorough notes, which is hard because you have no idea what is important. Tests are hard because you don't know what to study and he doesn't emphasize what he tests on.

His lectures are extremely hard to follow – he speaks slowly and pauses between words frequently. All lectures slides are essentially diagrams. Very grateful for the recorded lectures, but be prepared to spend lots of time reading the textbook.

He is really nice but not great at teaching. His lecture slides only contain figures with little to no texts so you basically have to note down everything he says without knowing which points are important or not. Some of the materials are a bit interesting but there is A LOT to memorize so it's definitely not an easy course.

He is very detail oriented and expects you to know your stuff. A lot of phylogeny-based questions on the final exam. Make sure you read the textbook thoroughly and keep up with lecture notes. Ask for help clarification or help whenever possible, he is willing to do research to help you out.

so much info in burns your brain. definately knows his stuff, too bad that his taxonomy was completely different from the textbook. if you can really focus in class and catch everythign you'll be fine, otherwise prepare yourself for many quality hours with the text.

You'd be hard-pressed to find a prof who loves his work as much as Mike does. While he certainly didn't make this class easy, he did give us fair warning at the start of the semester that it required lots of work. His lectures were fun and inspiring, every single time. It also helped that he chose great TA's. Mike Hart rocks!

Nice, genuine guy.  Class notes are just pictures/diagrams and you must write down own notes while he talks.  Midterm and final exam tricky; not much writing, lot's of 1-couple word answers.  Lots of nit-picky details to remember.
59% average on midterm :( way too much material on one midterm

Erin is excellent. She is kind, approachable, and great at explaining concepts and running interesting labs. She makes exams very fair and is abundantly clear about what to expect - she seems to really value student learning and success. Would recommend any class with her!
Always ready to help and really knows her stuff
